name: Honeysuckle Pattern
description: Honeysuckle plant pattern, symbolizing perseverance and endurance

name: Colored Winged Horse Pattern
meaning: Colorful life, good luck and prosperity
description: Colored version of the winged horse pattern
significance: Colorful version of the auspicious winged horse

name: Colored Linked Beads Pattern
description: Colored version of the Islamic linked beads pattern

name: Buketan Floral Bouquet Pattern
meaning: Combination of large decorative flowers reflecting Peranakan Chinese and Javanese aesthetic fusion
description: A classic Indonesian batik pattern centered around flower combinations, often used on scarves and clothing fabrics
significance: Represents the fusion of Chinese and Javanese cultures

name: Floral Bird Pattern
meaning: Fusion of Chinese cultural elements (peonies, birds) with Javanese batik craftsmanship
description: North Coast style batik from Javanese coastal areas, featuring realistic flowers and birds with decorative symmetrical arrangements
significance: Symbolizes the integration of Chinese and Javanese aesthetics

name: Peranakan Batik Pattern
meaning: Bright and complex patterns incorporating Chinese themes and auspicious symbols
description: Peranakan batik featuring Chinese motifs symbolizing traditional beliefs and wishes like happiness, abundance, and good fortune
significance: Symbolizes traditional Chinese beliefs and auspicious wishes

name: Diagonal Curve Pattern (Parang)
meaning: Symbolizes strength, resilience, and heritage (like waves that never retreat)
description: Traditional Javanese court pattern with flowing diagonal curves representing waves or sword blades
significance: Originally exclusive to royalty, symbolizes power and resilience

name: Kawung Palm Fruit Pattern
meaning: Represents purity, perfection, and balance of the four elements (wind, water, fire, earth)
description: One of Indonesia's oldest patterns based on kolang kaling (palm fruit) slices arranged in repetitive geometric patterns
significance: One of Indonesia's most ancient patterns, representing cosmic balance

name: Ceplok Geometric Pattern
meaning: Represents order, balance, and the regularity of life
description: Common Indonesian pattern featuring repeating geometric shapes, sometimes combined with floral or bird elements
significance: Derived from ancient temple decorations, symbolizing life's order
